Package com.example.qr_quest

Class UserDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.qr_quest.UserDatabase
  • public class UserDatabase
extends Object
    This class is used to handle the Firebase Cloud Firestore database operations related to Users It allows to add and query Users, as well as to check if a specific User already exists in the database and QR codes scanned by them.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  UserDatabase.RegistrationCallback
      The interface for the callback method to be called when user registration is successful.
      static interface  UserDatabase.UserExistsCallback
      The interface for the callback method to be called when checking if a user exists in the database.

                    User new_player)

        context - The Android application context
        new_player - The User object representing the current user

    • Method Detail

      • setRegistrationCallback

        public void setRegistrationCallback​(UserDatabase.RegistrationCallback registerCallback)
        Sets the callback object for user registration success events.
        Parameters:
        registerCallback - The object implementing the RegistrationCallback interface

      • setUserExistsCallback

        public void setUserExistsCallback​(UserDatabase.UserExistsCallback existsCallback)
        Sets the callback object for user existence check events.
        Parameters:
        existsCallback - The object implementing the UserExistsCallback interface

      • registerCheck

        public void registerCheck()
        Checks if the current user's username is already taken, and registers the user in the database if not. Also add the important deviceID to the SharedPreferences of the device.

      • checkIfUserExists

        public void checkIfUserExists​(String documentId)
        Checks whether a user with the specified document ID exists in the "Users" collection.
        Parameters:
        documentId - The ID of the document to check.

      • addUser

        public Map<String,​Object> addUser()
        Adds the user to the "Users" collection.
        Returns:
        A map representing the user to be added to the "Users" collection.

      • getDevice

        public static String getDevice​(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the unique ID of the device.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the application.
        Returns:
        The unique ID of the device.

      • getCurrentUser

        public static void getCurrentUser​(String deviceId,
                                  com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
        Gets the user with the specified device ID from the "Users" collection.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The ID of the device to get the user for.
        listener - The listener to be executed when the user is successfully retrieved.

      • getUser

        public static void getUser​(User user,
                           com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> listener)
        Retrieves a user document from the Firestore "Users" collection that matches the given username.
        Parameters:
        user - the user object with the username to search for
        listener - the success listener to invoke with the resulting document snapshot, or null if no matching document is found

      • updateUserDetails

        public static void updateUserDetails​(String prevUserName,
                                     User user,
                                     String deviceId,
                                     com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Boolean> listener)
        Updates the details of a user in the Firestore "Users" collection, and updates related documents in the "QRs" collection.
        Parameters:
        prevUserName - the previous username of the user, used to remove it from the "scanned_by" field of related QR documents
        user - the updated user object
        deviceId - the ID of the device that the user is associated with
        listener - the success listener to invoke with a boolean value indicating whether the update was successful or not

      • addQRCodeToUser

        public void addQRCodeToUser​(android.content.Context context,
                            QR qr,
                            com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Boolean> listener)
        Adds a QR code to the list of QR codes for the current user and updates it in the QR collection, adding the QR to it if needed
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the activity calling this method
        qr - The QR code to add to the user's list
        listener - A listener to be called when the QR code has been added. The listener should take a single Boolean parameter

      • getUserRank

        public static void getUserRank​(String username,
                               com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Integer> listener)
        Returns the rank of the user based on their score after comparing with all users in the collection
        Parameters:
        username - The user's username
        listener - A listener to be called when the rank is determined. The listener should take a single Integer parameter

      • getCaption

        public static void getCaption​(String username,
                              QR qrCode,
                              com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<String> listener)
        Retrieves the caption for a QR code associated with a given username.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user who scanned the QR code
        qrCode - the QR code object
        listener - an OnSuccessListener that is triggered when the caption is retrieved, with the retrieved caption as a parameter
